of the Landgren and Collins Families

Family Tree Lineage Index
Lars Nilsson Lindgren

Lars is listed as a “dräng” or farmhand/bachelor in the 1875-1883 parish record. He moved from Höör to “efter socknera” Bara on the 6th of Novemeber, 1877. He moved back to Höör on the 2nd of August, 1878.

Lars is listed as a “husman (reqrut)” or farmer and former recruit/solider in the 1884-1894 parish record.

Lars’ wife has her first daughter, Karna Mathilda, out of wedlock. In the 1867-1874 parish record, Karna Mathilda is listed as Johanna’s daughter, born on the 2nd of December, 1878 (3G). The corresponding birth index entry for Karna only lists Johanna as her mother, no father is listed(7). This happens one year before Johanna’s marriage to Lars Nilsson Lindgren, on the 30th of December, 1879 (4). Lars doesn’t officially move to Torupshus until November, and he had previously been living in Munkarp, around 60 km away (3H). Three years after their marriage, they have Nils Peter Landgren.

Lars moves away from the family on the 12th of November, 1890 (2?) wherein he is recorded as a “rymd” or runaway. Two years later, Johanna dies on the 13th of June, 1902 (2?, 5).

Under the “ ???? absent” section of the 1884-1894 parish records, he is recorded as a “husman” as well as a married man. Under additional notes he is also recorded as “Rymd från “ or a runaway from. In the next parish record, he is listed as a runaway with his wife’s death recorded in the widower section of the register.

Born: February 23, 1853 (1)

Birthplace: Höör, Malmöhus (Skåne), Sverige (Sweden) (1)

Mother: Hanna Nilsdotter (1)

Father: Nils Johnsson (1)

Wife: Johanna Ljungberg ()

Married: December 30, 1879 (2, 3, 4)

Marriage Place: Bara, Malmöhus (Skåne), Sverige (Sweden) (3, 2, 4)

Direct Descendant: Nils Peter Landgren (2, 3)

Death: June 13, 1902 (2, 5)

Death Place: Bara, Malmöhus (Skåne), Sverige (Sweden) (2, 5)

Burial Place: Unknown ()
